<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Size examples:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Type        SizeInBits  StoreSizeInBits  AllocSizeInBits&#91;&#42;&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ----        ----------  ---------------  ---------------</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  i1            1           8                8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  i8            8           8                8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  i19          19          24               32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  i32          32          32               32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  i100        100         104              128</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  i128        128         128              128</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  Float        32          32               32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  Double       64          64               64</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  X86&#95;FP80     80          80               96</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#91;&#42;&#93; The alloc size depends on the alignment, and thus on the target.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     These values are for x86-32 linux.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns the number of bits necessary to hold the specified type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For example, returns 36 for i36 and 80 for x86&#95;fp80. The type passed must</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// have a size (Type::isSized() must return true).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acf0b1898efd7f81a078e9288befd9290">getTypeSizeInBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns the maximum number of bytes that may be overwritten by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// storing the specified type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For example, returns 5 for i36 and 10 for x86&#95;fp80.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acfcd22eb38dbfe1acbf138754297437a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acfcd22eb38dbfe1acbf138754297437a">getTypeStoreSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> StoreSizeInBits = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#a3b229a84730d00c5e9ed36784521d304">getTypeStoreSizeInBits</a>(Ty);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns the maximum number of bits that may be overwritten by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// storing the specified type; always a multiple of 8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t AlignedSizeInBits =</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns true if no extra padding bits are needed when storing the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// specified type.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns the offset in bytes between successive objects of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// specified type, including alignment padding.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This is the amount that alloca reserves for this type. For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returns 12 or 16 for x86&#95;fp80, depending on alignment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#aa48b3b7e554b44f4e513d5dd8d9f9343"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#aa48b3b7e554b44f4e513d5dd8d9f9343">getTypeAllocSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Round up to the next alignment boundary.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="647"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In memory objects this is always aligned to a higher boundary, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="648"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only 80 bits contain information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a5e9e1c0dd93557be1b4ad72860f3cbdaabd37be4e521c37c8b5c07edbab59b8d7">Type::X86&#95;FP80TyID</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize/#a003b4369b4130e669dc9139798e0193c">TypeSize::getFixed</a>(80);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype">VectorType</a> &#42;VTy = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;VectorType&gt;</a>(Ty);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EltCnt = VTy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype/#a59632c5deb0423a518ad984bdd04d41f">getElementCount</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="655"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t MinBits = EltCnt.getKnownMinValue() &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="656"><span class="doxyHighlight">                       <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#acf0b1898efd7f81a078e9288befd9290">getTypeSizeInBits</a>(VTy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype/#afdce715c901d62e2c1367a0ff5248175">getElementType</a>()).<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/details/fixedorscalablequantity/#a33880aaca0ad05e5f1557f079305bde5">getFixedValue</a>();</span></CodeLine>
